summary: Cast spells in style with magic runes! Glowing glyphs will appear when casting spells or scrolls.  Apocalypse, Lost Grimoire and Forgotten Magic Redone compatible.
descriptionHtml:
[size=3] ﻿[/size][img]https://i.imgur.com/mNrZiHr.png[/img]﻿
[size=3]
[heading][color=yellow]REQUIREMENTS[/color][/heading] [/size]
 
[size=2]SKSE
[/size]Dawnguard
Dragonborn

[b][heading][/b][color=cyan]DESCRIPTION[/color][b][/heading]

[/b]When casting spells or scrolls, glowing runic circles will instantly appear from your hands. They emit light. Runes will automatically dispel themselves on sheathing them or if sneaking or turning invisible. 

NPCs can also cast runes. This can be disabled if needed.

There are over 30 different types of runic circles which will form based on the spell that is being cast. It is also compatible with every single spell mod by default, with additional support for [i]Apocalypse[/i], [i]Lost Grimoire of Skyrim[/i], and [i]Forgotten Magic Redone[/i] spells. No patches needed.

This has been tested with [i]Magiska[/i], [i]Mystic Knight[/i], and [i]Finally First Person Magic Animation[/i] mods. [i]Magiska[/i] and[i] Mystic Knight[/i] will need a patch which can be enabled in the MCM. [i]Finally First Person Magic Animation[/i] is compatible with or without this patch. Other animation mods will probably be fine at the risk of some clipping.

Comes with options for 2K and 1K textures.

 [size=3][heading][/size][color=cyan]CHANGELOG[/color][size=3][/heading][/size]

v1.0 - Initial Release

[size=3][b][heading][/b][color=cyan]NOTES[/color][b][/heading][/b][/size]

[size=2]1. 75 NPCs are supported at this time.
[/size]2. This mod works by checking for vanilla magic keywords, so generic runes will be cast for spell mods which lack them. 
3. Ritual and ward spells will be added in a later update.

[size=3][b][heading][/b][color=cyan]INSTALLATION[/color][b][/heading][/b][/size]

[size=2]Place this after any spell mods you have.
[/size][size=2]Install using Vortex/Mod Organizer[/size]

[size=3][heading][color=cyan]CREDITS[/color][/heading]

[/size]ObsidianDawn for the arcane circle brushes used.
author: powerofthree
